main event: A round, shiny object was observed on a northwest to southeast track over Riverside, New Jersey on July 25, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for 25 minutes.
There was a weather balloon observed heading southeast at the same time, which was determined to be the likely explanation for the sighting.
The object was described as round and shiny.
The object's altitude was estimated to be around 2,000 feet.
The sighting was reported by both civilian and military sources.
